island.0.book.tp.p1:
- Teleporter Guide -

When you purify an island, you unlock its %1$s.

%2$s while on it. Your vision will darken, preparing for teleportation.

Align your sights to a %3$s and %4$s to teleport away.
island.0.book.gacha.p1:
Shard Processor Manual


With a Shard in hand, insert it into the machine.

The better the Shard, the higher the quality of Artifacts you can obtain.
god.flora.unbelieve.msg.2.1: To think you would renounce your
god.flora.unbelieve.msg.2.3: Then go — do as you wish…
god.nyaptov.believe.msg.1.3: (Do try your best to survive then…)
god.nyaptov.believe.msg.2.2: (If you’ve ever got time to spare,)
god.nyaptov.believe.msg.2.3: (some fish would be nice to have.)
god.nyaptov.mercy.msg.2: (Your calls are heard — accept this grace.)
god.rumor.unbelieve.msg.1.2: To betray me just like that…
god.urban.believe.msg.2.1: My power is yours to wield.
god.urban.unbelieve.msg.2.1: I placed my trust in you, yet…
god.wiki.believe.msg.1.2: I look forward to what you can
god.wiki.believe.msg.2.1: Have a taste of the power you seek.
god.wiki.believe.msg.2.2: May primal magic flow in your favor.
god.wiki.unbelieve.msg.1.1: So this is all you could
god.wiki.mercy.msg.1: Then you shall receive my blessing.
god.mercy.offering.unrequired: You don't need to receive mercy right now.
god.belief_change.warn: All unclaimed lost items will be gone forever. Are you sure you want to change faiths?
chat.tutorial.1.1: A curse has befallen the islands of this realm.
chat.tutorial.1.2.s: You have but one goal: To %s
chat.tutorial.1.2.m: You and your allies have but one goal: To %s
chat.tutorial.1.with: fully rid the curse from this realm.
chat.tutorial.2.s:
Before you lies a %s, the source of an island’s affliction.
You must cleanse the curse that lay within.
Get close and offer a prayer (Hold %s without moving) to cleanse the Artifact.
chat.tutorial.2.m:
Before you lies a %s, the source of an island’s affliction.
You and your allies must cleanse the curse that lay within.
Get close and offer a prayer (Hold %s without moving) to cleanse the Artifact.
chat.tutorial.2.skip: You must cleanse the Artifact. Get close and offer a prayer (Hold %s without moving).
chat.tutorial.3:
When you cleanse an island, you gain a blessing. These items are called %s.
Artifacts are special items that can only be wielded by those who worship a Deity.
chat.tutorial.4.s:
This realm is home to 5 great %s, of whom you will eventually be able to worship.
Through worship, you are graced with blessings and can wield the power of Artifacts.
Though blasphemous, you may change faiths at any time.
chat.tutorial.4.m:
This realm is home to 5 great %s, of whom you and your allies will eventually be able to worship.
Through worship, you are graced with blessings and can wield the power of Artifacts.
Though blasphemous, you may change faiths at any time.
chat.tutorial.5:
%s are scattered throughout the realm, through which monsters emerge.
These spawners can only be broken by slaying the emerging wave of monsters.
chat.tutorial.6.s:
When slain, a %s is built where you fell, protecting your items.
Graves can be harvested through %s.
However, if you are slain before you can reach it, your items will be claimed by your worshipped Deity.
If you fall into the void, your items will be claimed by your Deity with no grave.
chat.tutorial.6.m:
When slain, a %s is built where you fell, protecting your items.
Graves can be harvested through %s.
However, if you are slain before you can reach it, your items will be claimed by your worshipped Deity.
If you fall into the void, your items will be claimed by your Deity with no grave.
chat.tutorial.7:
Lost items can be %s from the Pantheon after cleansing an island.
You may also beg for your Deity’s mercy to reclaim a portion of your lost items.
chat.tutorial.8:
Past this gate, a portal to the %s lies nearby.
The best course of action would be to make your way to it and worship a Deity.
chat.island_purify.title: ISLAND PURIFIED
chat.island_purify.notif: [!] Lost items have been returned to the Pantheon.
chat.tips.1:
Stone has a chance to drop ore when mined, with each pickaxe tier increasing the rate of drops.
Cobblestone can also drop ores, but at a reduced rate and quality.
chat.tips.2: Islands can be cleansed even without breaking their spawners.
chat.tips.3:
Fall DMG in this realm is stronger than usual.
Even with plenty of health, careless mistakes can still be costly.
chat.tips.4: When your items are claimed by a Deity, you can pray for mercy to reclaim a portion of your lost items.
chat.tips.5:
Certain Artifacts have the ability to rescue you from the void, should you ever fall in.
The “Divine Protection” set is one such Artifact.
chat.tips.6:
While trading, [ꜱpᴀᴄᴇ+ʟᴇꜰᴛ ꜱʜɪꜰᴛ] on a selected trade can speed up the process.
 Convenient for bulk trading.
chat.tips.7: Farming crops is a more efficient way of farming currency over wool.
chat.tips.8:
Walking into battle with no armor is equivalent to suicide.
If lacking in defensive Artifacts, the cheap Armor Kits on offer are better than nothing.
chat.tips.9:
The Book of All-Seeing sold by the General Supplier can be used to inspect info on yourself and your targets.
If faced with a foe stronger than your gear, turning back would be a smart choice.
chat.tips.10:
Natural Regeneration remains active even when not fully satiated.
Health restored from Natural Regeneration also scales with your Max HP.
chat.tips.11:
During combat, natural health regeneration is considerably reduced.
When low on HP, retreat may be a wise choice.
chat.tips.12:
You can visit any island at any time.
However, beware of enemies that greatly surpass you in strength.
chat.tips.13:
Many offensive Artifacts come with different cooldown timers.
Artifacts that share the same timer can't be used immediately after another.
chat.tips.14: In the End dimension, where time and weather hold no meaning, Artifacts that rely on it can operate at their full potential.
chat.tips.15:
Debuffs afflicted by enemies can found as %s and %s effects.
These are indicated by the amount of lines in their icon in the bottom-left corner.
chat.tips.16: When up against AoE or ground attacks, a third-person perspective may be a helpful tactic.
chat.tips.17:
Nectar sold by the Potion Merchant is the most basic healing Artifact.
When sparse in other healing options, these may come in handy.
chat.tips.18:
Artifacts that use the Special Cooldown often pack a lot of firepower.
Up against strong foes, these may turn the tide of battle. Use them wisely.
chat.tips.19: For backup wool, food, and Artifact hoards, a %s can make for a smooth journey.
chat.tips.20:
Summon-type Artifacts are effective against enemies that fly freely in the air.
They'll make quick work of them when deployed.
chat.tips.21:
If you find that enemies are difficult to kill, they may be resistant towards your Artifact's element(s).
Try different builds and Artifacts based on your faith and enemy's resistances.
settings.diff.change.queue.in_battle: Difficulty will change when all players are no longer in combat.
settings.diff.change.queue.in_progress: A difficulty change request is already queued.
settings.diff.notif.player.queue: If nobody declines, the difficulty will change in 30s after all players are no longer in combat.

settings.show_playtime.change: Show Playtime on Island Cleansing: Switched %s
diff.1.desc: For players who mainly play Survival. (Default)
diff.2.desc:
For players seeking a challenge.
- Increased enemy HP
- Increased enemy DMG
- Some enemies gain powerful abilities
diff.3.desc:
No mercy.
- Greatly increased enemy HP
- Greatly increased enemy DMG
- Some enemies gain demanding abilities
